title: Authors and Citation
text: Rosie Smith. Author, maintainer. Heidi Swanson. Funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Smith R (2023). mort: mort: Identifying potential mortalities expelled tags aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays. https://github.com/rosieluain/mort, https://rosieluain.github.io/mort/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {mort: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays},   author = {Rosie Smith},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/rosieluain/mort, https://rosieluain.github.io/mort/}, }

what: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: goal mort provide framework identify potential mortalities expelled tags passive acoustic telemetry arrays non-overlapping receivers. potential mortalities flagged mort reviewed user, considered removal dataset. Please note method conservative, therefore may overestimate number mortalities system. therefore advised use results estimates survival tagging effects. Rather, purpose remove reduce potential bias conducting analyses. mort uses thresholds dataset , use-defined thresholds, several customizable options, allow application wide number species acoustic arrays. providing standardized framework consideration potential mortalities, hope tool useful encourage greater reproducibility acoustic telemetry research.

title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: can install mort GitHub line . Note must package devtools installed.
code: devtools::install_github("rosieluain/mort")

title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: Please see package vignettes details, well guidelines tips following functions.

title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: residences condenses detection records residence events, start time, end time, duration. Residence events used input mort functions. mortsplot generates plots residence events using ggplot2. Plots automatically formatted maximize visibility dataset, can modified using ggplot2 commands. Interactive plots can also generated using plotly.

what: Identifying potential mortalities or expelled tags
title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: morts identifies potential mortalities expelled tags, based duration single residence events cumulative residence events (see vignettes complete explanation). Thresholds derived input dataset. infrequent identifies potential mortalities expelled tags infrequent intermittent detections. Thresholds timeframes defined user. review examines new data determine animal previously flagged mortality moved, may therefore alive.

title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: functions may called morts /infrequent, depending options selected. functions fully documented user can explore data process used mort. stationchange identifies recent station location change animal (.e., last time animal moved, therefore assumed alive). resmax extracts residence events occurred prior recent station change individual. resmaxcml generates cumulative residence events (first time animal detected given station last time animal detected station, ignoring gaps detection) occurred prior recent station change individual. drift creates drift events sequential residence events, detected movement stations may due drifting dead animal expelled tag. season selects residence events user-specified seasons periods interest. backwards shifts start time flagged mortality earlier, residence event triggered flag earliest consecutive residence event station/location.

title: mort: Identifying potential mortalities and expelled tags in aquatic acoustic telemetry arrays
text: mort brand new. Although tested extensively complex dataset, expect issues arise mort applied datasets systems. run issues suggestions improvements, please post issue, ’ll see can !

what: Shift start time of potential mortalities earlier — backwards
title: Shift start time of potential mortalities earlier — backwards
text: Shift start time potential mortalities earlier, station/location changed.

title: Shift start time of potential mortalities earlier — backwards
code: backwards(data, morts, ID, station, res.start, stnchange = NULL)

title: Shift start time of potential mortalities earlier — backwards
text: data dataframe residence events. Residence events must include tag ID, location name, start time, duration. Residence events continuous (.e., subset season). morts dataframe containing potential mortalities. Must use #' column names order data. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt format="manual". stnchange dataframe start time location recent station location change. Must use column names order data.

title: Shift start time of potential mortalities earlier — backwards
text: dataframe one row tag ID, including date/time residence start potential mortality expelled tag identified. Returns input morts dataframe potential mortalities shifted earlier. input data fields (e.g., name, location, species information included input data) retained.

title: Shift start time of potential mortalities earlier — backwards
code: if (FALSE) backwards(data=data,morts=morts,ID="TagID",station="Receiver", res.start="ResidencesStart",stnchange=stn.change)

title: Dead drift — drift
text: Identifies sequential residence events detected movement stations may due drifting expelled tag dead animal.

title: Dead drift — drift
code: drift(   data,   type,   ID,   station,   res.start,   res.end,   residences,   units,   ddd,   from.station,   to.station,   cutoff = NULL,   cutoff.units = NULL,   progress.bar = TRUE )

title: Dead drift — drift
text: data data frame residence events. Residence events must include tag ID, location name, start time, end time. type method used generate residence events data. Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". "manual", user must specify ID, station, res.start, res.end. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". res.end string name column data holds end date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". residences character string name column data holds duration residence events. units units duration residence events data. ddd dataframe stations/locations detected movement stations may due drifting expelled tag dead animal. .station string name column data contains station/location names drifting detections may start . .station string name column data contains station/location names drifting detections may move . cutoff maximum allowable time difference detections considered single residence event. Default NULL. cutoff.units units cutoff. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". progress.bar option display progress bar drift applied. Default TRUE.

title: Dead drift — drift
text: data frame one row residence event. Format input residence events, events may due dead drift combined single residence events.

title: Dead drift — drift
code: if (FALSE) drift(data=data,format="manual",ID="TagID",station="Receiver", res.start="ResidenceStart",res.end="ResidenceEnd",ddd=driftstations, from.station="FrStation",to.station="ToStation")

what: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
title: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
text: Identifies potential mortalities expelled tags infrequent detections passive acoustic telemetry data. Mortalities identfied based user-defined threshold timeframe.

title: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
code: infrequent(   data,   type = "mort",   ID,   station,   res.start = "auto",   res.end = "auto",   residences = "auto",   units = "auto",   method,   threshold,   threshold.units = NULL,   recent.period = NULL,   recent.units = NULL,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   morts.prev = NULL,   replace = FALSE,   backwards = FALSE,   ddd = NULL,   from.station = NULL,   to.station = NULL,   drift.cutoff = NULL,   drift.units = NULL )

title: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
text: data dataframe residence events. Residence events must include tag ID, location name, start time, duration. Residence events must also include end time season provided. type format used generate residence events. Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". "manual", user must specify ID, station, res.start, res.end, residences, units. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". res.end string name column data holds end date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". residences residences character string name column data holds duration residence events. units Units duration residence events data. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". method character string threshold method. Options "recent" "defined". "recent", must specify recent.period recent.units. "defined", must specify start end. threshold minimum summed duration residence events animal considered alive. Units must units residences. threshold.units units threshold. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". NULL, assumed units. recent.period length period time animal must detected longer threshold considered alive. period ends recent detection given animal. recent.units units recent.period. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". start character string start user-defined time period search infrequent detections method="defined". Must format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. time zone res.start assumed UTC time zone defined res.start. end character string end user-defined time period search infrequent detections method="defined". Must format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. time zone res.start assumed UTC time zone defined res.start. morts.prev dataframe containing potential mortalities. dataframe must columns order data. replace morts specified animal infrequent detections already morts, record morts replaced TRUE. Default FALSE. backwards option examine residence events prior one flagged potential mortality. prior residence events station/location flagged event, time potential mortality shifted earlier. ddd optional dataframe stations/locations detected movement stations may due drifting expelled tag dead animal. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may start . Must identical station/location names data. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may move . Must identical station/location names data. drift.cutoff maximum allowable time difference detections considered single residence event. Recommended used generate residence events data. drift.units units cutoff. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". Recommended used generate residence events data.

title: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
text: morts=NULL, dataframe one row tag ID, including date/time residence start potential mortality expelled tag identified. morts specified, potential mortalities added existing morts dataframe. input data fields (e.g., name, location, species information included input data) retained.

title: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
text: Example method="recent": threshold=10 recent.period=1 recent.units="years", animal flagged potential mortality detected less 10 minutes within year, ending recent detection. Example method="defined": threshold=10 start="2019-10-01" end="2020-06-01", animal flagged potential mortality detected less 10 minutes 01 October 2019 01 June 2020.

title: Identify potential mortalities from infrequent detections — infrequent
code: ## Recent example if (FALSE) infrequent(data=data,format="manual",ID="TagID",station="Receiver", res.start="ResStart",res.end="ResEnd",residences="ResidenceLength.days", units="days",method="recent",threshold=0.5,recent.period=1, recent.units="years") ## User-defined example if (FALSE) infrequent(data=data,format="manual",ID="TagID",station="Receiver", res.start="ResStart",res.end="ResEnd",residences="ResidenceLength.days", units="days",method="defined",threshold=0.5,start="2019-10-01", end="2020-06-01")

what: Identify potential mortalities or expelled tags — morts
title: Identify potential mortalities or expelled tags — morts
text: Identifies potential mortalities expelled tags passive acoustic telemetry data. Mortalities identified based thresholds derived dataset .

title: Identify potential mortalities or expelled tags — morts
code: morts(   data,   type = "mort",   ID,   station,   res.start = "auto",   res.end = "auto",   method = "all",   units = "auto",   residences = "auto",   singles = TRUE,   backwards = FALSE,   drift = "none",   ddd = NULL,   from.station = NULL,   to.station = NULL,   drift.cutoff = NULL,   drift.units = NULL,   season.start = NULL,   season.end = NULL,   season.overlap = TRUE,   morts.prev = NULL )

title: Identify potential mortalities or expelled tags — morts
text: data dataframe residence events. Residence events must include tag ID, location name, start time, duration. Residence events must also include end time season provided. type method used generate residence events. Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". "manual", user must specify ID, station, res.start, res.end, residences, units. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". res.end string name column data holds end date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". method method used flagging mortalities. Options "last", "", "cumulative", "" units units duration residence events data. residences character string name column data holds duration residence events. singles specifies single detections (length residence event = 0) retained. Default TRUE. Note single detections removed (singles=FALSE), backwards also include single detections. backwards option examine residence events prior one flagged potential mortality. prior residence events station/location flagged event, time potential mortality shifted earlier. Note backwards=TRUE, output method="last" method="". drift option account potential drifting identifying thresholds /mortalities. Options "none", "threshold", "morts", "". Default "none". ddd dataframe stations/locations detected movement stations may due drifting expelled tag dead animal. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may start . Must identical station/location names data. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may move . Must identical station/location names data. drift.cutoff maximum allowable time difference detections considered single residence event. Recommended used generate residence events data. drift.units units cutoff. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". Recommended used generate residence events data. season.start start date/time(s) period interest. period interest study years, must character string format "dd-mm". Otherwise, must POSIXt, character string format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. season.end end date/time(s) period interest. period interest study years, must character string format "dd-mm". Otherwise, must POSIXt, character string format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. season.overlap option include residence events overlap either beginning end period interest. TRUE, full overlapping residence events retained. FALSE, portion residence events within period interest retained, residences recalculated, using specified units. Default TRUE morts.prev dataframe containing potential mortalities. dataframe must columns order data. season dataframe start end dates season(s) interest

title: Identify potential mortalities or expelled tags — morts
text: dataframe one row tag ID, including date/time residence start potential mortality expelled tag identified. input data fields (e.g., name, location, species information included input data) retained.

title: Identify potential mortalities or expelled tags — morts
code: if (FALSE) mort(data=res.events,format="manual",units="days",residences="ResidenceLength")

title: Plot residence events — mortsplot

title: Plot residence events — mortsplot
code: mortsplot(   data,   type,   ID,   station,   res.start = "auto",   res.end = "auto",   morts = NULL,   singles = TRUE,   interactive = FALSE,   residences = NULL,   units = NULL,   season.start = NULL,   season.end = NULL,   facet = FALSE,   facet.axis = "x",   facet.by = "season" )

title: Plot residence events — mortsplot
text: data dataframe residence events. Residence events must include tag ID, location name, start time, end time. Residence events must also include duration making interactive plot. type method used generate residence events. Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". res.end string name column data holds end date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". morts dataframe containing potential mortalities. dataframe must ID, station, res.start, res.end, residences column names data. singles option adjust end times residence events single detection events visible. Adjustment visualization purposes obscure impact visualization residence events. interactive option generate interactive plot. residences optional character string name column data holds duration residence events. Required generating interactive plot applying season. units units duration residence events data. Required applying season. season.start start date/time(s) period interest. period interest study years, must character string format "dd-mm". Otherwise, must POSIXt, character string format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. season.end end date/time(s) period interest. period interest study years, must character string format "dd-mm". Otherwise, must POSIXt, character string format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. facet option facet year season. TRUE, season.start season.end must provided. facet.axis option position facets along x y axis. Options "x" "y". Default "x". Note facet.axis can "y" facet.="year". facet.option facet "season" (defined season.start season.end) "year". Default "season".

title: Plot residence events — mortsplot
text: ggplot2 plot. Additional arguments (e.g., formatting axes, legend, aes, manual colour scales) can added ggplot2 plot. interactive=TRUE, returns plotly plot.

title: Plot residence events — mortsplot
code: if (FALSE) plot<-mortsplot(data=data,type="mort",ID="TagID",station="Station.Name", interactive=TRUE,residences="auto")

title: Generate residence events — residences
text: Generate residence events passive acoustic telemetry data.

title: Generate residence events — residences
text: data data frame detection data. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. datetime string name column data holds date time. cutoff maximum allowable time difference detections considered single residence event. units units cutoff. also units used calculate duration residence events. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks".

title: Generate residence events — residences
text: data frame one row residence event, including date/time residence start, date/time residence end, duration residence event. input data fields (e.g., name, location, species information included detection data) retained.

title: Generate residence events — residences
text: Note progress bar appears, based many unique tag IDs processed. delay progress bar appears progress bar reached 100%, may substantial depending size telemetry dataset.

ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt format="manual". residences character string name column data holds duration residence events. stnchange dataframe start time location recent station location change. Must use column names data. drift indicates drift residence events included determining maximum residence duration

what: Review previously identified mortalities using new data — review

title: Review previously identified mortalities using new data — review
code: review(   morts,   new.data,   old.data = NULL,   type,   ID,   station,   res.start = "auto",   res.end = NULL,   residences = NULL,   units = NULL,   ddd = NULL,   from.station = NULL,   to.station = NULL )

title: Review previously identified mortalities using new data — review
text: morts dataframe previously flagged mortalities. Format need match new.data, names formats ID, station, res.start fields must match input dataframes. new.data dataframe new residence events (.e., generated detection data included earlier mort analyses). old.data optional dataframe residence events used earlier mort analyses. drift applied earlier analyses, including old.data recommended avoid falsely identifying station changes. type method used generate residence events. Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". "manual", user must specify ID, station, res.start, res.end, residences, units. ID string name column morts new.data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column morts new.data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column morts new.data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. res.end optional string name column morts new data holds end date time. needed drift applied. residences optional character string name column morts new.data holds duration residence events. needed drift applied. units optional units duration residence events morts new.data. needed drift applied. ddd dataframe stations/locations detected movement stations may due drifting expelled tag dead animal. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may start . Must identical station/location names morts new.data. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may move . Must identical station/location names morts new.data.

title: Review previously identified mortalities using new data — review
text: dataframe one row tag ID morts station/location change identified new.data. remaining fields include information residence event identified station change, station change can verified user removing animal morts. input data fields (e.g., name, location, species information included input data) retained.

title: Review previously identified mortalities using new data — review
code: if (FALSE) undead<-review(morts=morts,new.data=new.data,old.data=old.data, ID="TagID",station="Station.Name",res.start="ResidenceStart")

what: Select residence events from specified seasons — season
title: Select residence events from specified seasons — season
text: Select residence events specified seasons, used identify potential mortalities expelled tags. Useful animals show strong seasonal patterns behaviour. example, reduction movement winter may falsely identified mortality, increase threshold use identify mortalities, cause potential mortalities missed.

title: Select residence events from specified seasons — season
text: data dataframe residence events. Residence events must include tag ID, start time, end time, duration. type method used generate residence events. Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". "manual", user must specify res.start, res.end, residences, units. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". res.end string name column data holds end date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". residences character string name column data holds duration residence events. units Units duration residence events data. Options "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". season.start start date/time(s) period interest. period interest study years, must character string format "dd-mm". Otherwise, must POSIXt, character string format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. season.end end date/time(s) period interest. period interest study years, must character string format "dd-mm". Otherwise, must POSIXt, character string format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS. overlap option include residence events overlap either beginning end period interest. TRUE, full overlapping residence events retained. FALSE, portion residence events within period interest retained, residences recalculated, using specified units. Default TRUE.

title: Select residence events from specified seasons — season
text: dataframe format input data, residence events limited period(s) interest.

title: Select residence events from specified seasons — season

title: Identify most recent station change — stationchange

Options "mort", "actel", "glatos", "vtrack", "manual". "manual", user must specify ID, station, res.start, residences. ID string name column data holds tag sample IDs. station string name column data holds station name receiver location. res.start string name column data holds start date time. Must specified POSIXt format="manual". res.end string name column data holds end date time. Must specified POSIXt character format YYYY-mm-dd HH:MM:SS format="manual". residences character string name column data holds duration residence events. singles specifies single detections (length residence event = 0) retained. Default TRUE. drift option account potential drifting identifying station changes. ddd dataframe stations/locations detected movement stations may due drifting expelled tag dead animal. units optional units duration residence events data. Required drift=TRUE. Options "auto", "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may start . Must identical station/location names data. .station string name column ddd contains station/location names drifting detections may move . Must identical station/location names data.
